section.title: Description
section.p:
Creates and queues a standard
Hadoop MapReduce job.

tr.td: Name of the jar file for Map Reduce to use.
Name of the class for Map Reduce to use.
Comma seperated jar files to include in the classpath.
Comma separated files to be copied to the map reduce cluster
Set a program argument using the syntax arg=NAME=VALUE.
Set an Hadoop configuration variable using the syntax define=NAME=VALUE
A directory where Templeton will write the status of the Map Reduce job. If provided, it is the caller's responsibility to remove this directory when done.
A string containing the job id similar to "job_201110132141_0001".
A JSON object containing the information returned when the job was queued. See the Hadoop documentation (Class TaskController) for more information.

section.title: Example
section.source: % curl -d user.name=charlotte \ -d jar=wordcount.jar \ -d class=org.myorg.WordCount \ -d libjars=transform.jar,wordcount.jar \ -d arg=wordcount/input \ -d statusdir=status \ -d arg=wordcount/output \ 'http://localhost:8080/templeton/v1/mapreduce/jar.json' {"id":"job_201110132141_0008", "info":{ "stdout":"packageJobJar: [] [/Users/charlotte/var/hadoop/hadoop-0.20.203.0/contrib/jar/hadoop-jar-0.20.203.0.jar] ...", "stderr":"2011-10-17 15:00:09.693 java[50410:1803] Unable to load realm info from SCDynamicStore\n11/10/17 15:00:10 WARN ...", "exitCode":0}} %
